Data.buttonPrint2DSingle_ToolTip: Export Family 2D view to image file
Data.buttonPrint2DMulti_ToolTip: Export List of Families 2D view from Folder to image files
Data.buttonPrint3DSingle_ToolTip: Export Family Isometric view to image file
Data.buttonPrint3DMulti_ToolTip: Create 3D family image from selected folder
Data.buttonPrintView_ToolTip: Export Current View to image file
Data.labelSize_ToolTip: Defines “height” proportion of the exported image in pixels
Data.labelSize_ToolTip_Example: Example: Image height = 1080 with Aspect ratio 16:9 produces image with 1920:1080 resolution
Data.labelScale_ToolTip: Defines the scale of the exported view in the following manner: larger scale value produces more accurate exported view scale (thinner lines)
Data.labelZoom_ToolTip: Defines the indents of the exported view in percentages
Data.labelZoom_ToolTip_Note: Note: this option is ignored in command “Export Current View” and the resulted image will not be zoomed. Picture has 5% indent by default and this cannot be changed
Data.labelZoom_ToolTip_Example: Example: Zoom = 100 produces an image with common indent 5%, Zoom = 50 results an image with indent 55%
Data.labelResolution_ToolTip: Defines the resolution of the exported image in dots per inch
Data.labelResolution_ToolTip_Note: “Web Low” = 72 DPI,#“Web High” = 150 DPI,#“Print Low” = 300 DPI,#“Print High” = 600 DPI
Data.labelDetailLevel_ToolTip: Corresponds to the detail level in Revit
Data.labelDetailLevel_ToolTip_Note: Note: while exporting isometric view detail level is always set as “Fine” and this cannot be changed
Data.labelFormat_ToolTip: Defines the image format of the exported image
Data.labelAspectRatio_ToolTip: Defines the aspect ratio of the exported image depending on image height value
Data.labelAspectRatio_ToolTip_Note: Note: this option is ignored in command “Export Current View” and the resulted resolution will be equal to the active view resolution
Data.labelAspectRatio_ToolTip_Example: Example: Aspect ratio 4:3 with Image height = 768 produces image with 1024:768 resolution
Data.buttonApply_ToolTip: Apply button let preview changes, that is to transform current view applying entered values.#This button is available only during the export of single image.
Data.buttonApply_ToolTip_Note: This button is available only during the export of single image
Data.buttonPrint_ToolTip: Print button changes current view applying entered values and saves these values to display them the next time the “Image Print Settings” window will be opened. (Enter)
Data.errorMessageValuesSaving: Error occurred during saving user input values
Data.errorMessageValuesLoading: Error occurred during loading user input values
Data.errorMessageDuringPrinting: Errors occurred during printing images. %amount% images are missed.#Check log file for details
Data.errorMessageViewCorrecting: Error occurred during current view correction
Data.errorMessageViewPrinting: Error occurred during printing of current view
Data.errorMessage2dFolderPrintingCycle: Error occurred in cycle during 2D folder printing
Data.errorMessage3dFolderPrintingCycle: Error occurred in cycle during 3D folder printing
Data.errorMessageFamiliesRetrieving: Error occurred during retrieving families from folder
Data.errorMessageProjectProcessing: Error occurred during processing of project
Data.errorMessageFamilyRemoving: Error occurred during removing family from project
Data.errorMessageFamilyLoading: Error occurred during loading family from file
Data.errorMessageInstanceRemoving: Error occurred during removing instance from project
Data.errorMessageInstanceInserting: Error occurred during inserting of instance
Data.errorMessageTypeRemoving: Error occurred during removing type from project
Data.warningMessageProjectsAmount: Attention! The amount of projects created is not equal to the amount of types in families. Check the log file.
Data.fileDialogTitle: Select the directory to save the image
Data.folderDialogFromTitle: Select the directory with families to be printed
Data.folderDialogToTitle: Select the directory to save printed files
Data.textBlockProcessCreatingProjects: Creating .rvt projects from .rfa files, this may take some time...
